eligibility: All land-holding farmer families (subject to some exclusions and conditions).
benefits: ₹6,000 per year, delivered in three equal instalments of ₹2,000 each. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}
application_steps: Register online via the official portal or through Common Service Centres (CSCs). Provide landholding and bank account details.
documents: Aadhaar Card, Land Ownership Papers (or land-holding certificate), Bank Account Details.
notes: Institutional land-holders often not eligible; scheme covers small and marginal farmers under certain criteria.

eligibility: Farmers growing notified crops in notified areas; loanee and non-loanee farmers under certain conditions. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}
benefits: Crop insurance coverage against natural calamities, pests, diseases, post-harvest losses; premiums are subsidised (e.g., 2% for Kharif, 1.5% for Rabi, 5% for horticultural crops). :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}
application_steps: Apply via appointed insurance company/agent in the notified area before the cut-off date; submit crop & area details.
documents: Land records, Aadhaar, Bank account, Crop details, Previous yield history (if required).
notes: Scheme details (premium rate, notified crops/areas) vary by state and season.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchai Yojana (PMKSY) – “Per Drop More Crop”
eligibility: Farmers of all categories; small & marginal farmers given priority. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}

notes: State-wise terms (subsidy %age, eligible area) may vary.

eligibility: All farmers eligible for soil health card. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}
benefits: Provides soil testing report and recommended fertiliser/dose every 2-3 years to improve soil health and productivity. :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}
application_steps: Collect soil sample from field/plot and submit to nearest Soil Testing Lab or Agriculture Office; follow the online submission process if available.
documents: Aadhaar, Land details (field/plot), Sample collection requisition form.
notes: Helps optimise fertiliser use, thereby improving productivity and reducing cost.

eligibility: All farmers, tenant farmers, oral lessees, Self Help Groups (engaged in agriculture) eligible. :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}

application_steps: Visit the nearest bank branch or apply online (if bank provides) for KCC; submit required documents & land/crop details.

eligibility: Farmers, farm-based enterprises, states under plan scheme. :contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}

eligibility: Beekeepers and farmers interested in apiculture. :contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}
